title: Bug 12906: Unable to open file in another editor if it is already opened in one editor (should give error message)
description: Bug 12906: Unable to open file in another editor if it is already opened in one editor (should give error message)
OB: When trying to open a file in another editor that is already opened in one editor, nothing happens.
EB: However, there should be a warning message saying that you may overwrite changes and asking if you want to continue, or an error message saying that you should close all files first.
SR:
To reproduce the issue: 
1. Make sure you have an associated Windows editor for your Java file. If not, go to the file explorer, double click on any Java file, and select WordPad or Notepad as the default editor for all Java files. 
2. In the Java Perspective, right-click on the Java file and select 'Open With' -> 'System Editor'. A Notepad or WordPad window will pop up with the Java file opened. Close it. 
3. Go back to the Java Perspective and open a Java file by simply double-clicking on it. 
4. Now, right-click on the Java file and select 'Open With' -> 'System Editor'. 

Expected result: A warning message should appear in the workbench, indicating that you may overwrite changes and asking if you want to continue. Alternatively, an error message should appear, stating that you should close all files first. We believe this is a safety feature where the editor doesn't allow external editing while the file is already opened in the editor.
